effect.text: Choose 1 of your own Pokémon in play and a Stage of Evolution. Discard all Evolution cards of that Stage or higher attached to that Pokémon. That Pokémon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, Poisoned, or anything else that might be the result of an attack (just as if you had evolved it).

tips: Check the damage on your Pokemon before devolving; make sure the lower stage can survive
Use proactively to remove status conditions before they become game-losing
Consider keeping evolutions in hand to re-evolve after devolving
Devolving can save a Pokemon your opponent thought they'd knock out
The status removal effect is sometimes more valuable than the devolution itself

rulings.ruling: You choose which stage of evolution to remove; you can devolve from Stage 2 to Stage 1, or Stage 1 to Basic
All damage counters remain on the Pokemon after devolving
If the remaining Pokemon (after devolution) has damage equal to or exceeding its HP, it is immediately knocked out
All special conditions and attack effects are removed when you devolve
Energy cards and other attached cards remain attached to the Pokemon
The discarded evolution cards go to your discard pile
You cannot devolve a Basic Pokemon (it has no evolution to remove)
Devolution happens immediately and cannot be responded to
You can devolve a Pokemon on the turn you evolved it
If you devolve a Stage 2 to Basic, you discard both the Stage 1 and Stage 2 cards
The Pokemon is treated as if it just evolved (cannot attack if it was just placed that turn, but devolution itself doesn't count as playing)
